text:
So how many of you like
to come home to a sewage
backup in your home?
Nobody.
Yeah, me either.
Neither does Noah.

50% of sewer clogs and
backups are caused by grease.

So that grease hardens and
causes these overflows.

It costs US taxpayers
$15 billion a year

to clean the grease
out of the pipes
and keep the sewer flowing.

In 1884, they invented this
thing called a grease trap.
It's this big box.

And it's meant to rely on
gravity to separate oil

from the sewer
water, and then let
the water go on down the drain.

The problem is that
these old devices--
they just don't work very well.

And we end up with a lot
of grease in the sewer,
and a lot of backups and clogs.
So we invented Neptune.

Neptune is the only
patent-pending point-of-source

grease interceptor that's
capable of removing 95% to 99%

of those fats, oils, and
greases from that sewer stream.
So it's a great technology.

It fits right under the
sink of the restaurant.

It's easier and cheaper
to install and maintain.

And so we save cities and
restaurants a lot of money.

The IoT-enabled device is going
to make city sewers work a lot
smarter, a lot more efficient.

If you don't like a
bathtub full of E. coli,

You should probably
vote for Neptune.
Thank you.
